column4: Hey, what program is the little calender that pops up when you click the date link too?
I mean, I know when you click on it, and see the calender, it can show you all the appointments you have made, but I don't know what program you have to save the appointments in.
oh, that's saved in evolution, the mail/calender app
do you see a grub menu when you boot?
Yea, but it only give me access to mint.
Win doesnt even show up on the list
ok, what partition is your windows on?
and the partition of the second drive?
no, that's the drive; like sdb1 or sdb2 ,   sudo fdisk -l  should give you an idea
add the stanza in http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/49460/  to the very end of /boot/grub/menu.lst
keep that reference, you might need it
try editing /etc/usplash.conf to a res your monitor knows
but at some point you get a usable display in X?
It works fine, as soon as it boots the GUI.
Thanks, that should work. It's set to 12something by 1024, and my LCD wont work with anything bigger then 1024x800 or w/e.
